title: Between 1 July 2017 and 30 June 2018, will an armed group from Yemen engage in a campaign that systematically kills 1,000 or more civilians in Yemen?
preds:
unbelievable wisdom of crowds
last year i said no way and did very well in Burma
but we missed all the signs of ongoing genocide
same here
Based on general news and GJP consensus.
Based on general news and GJP consensus.
Yemen is delicate, but a systematic intentional mass killing?

outside intervention/saudi-arabian led airstrikes won't count to resolve this question. while the state army, the huthi, al-quaida and ISIS are perpetrating war crimes. I don't suspect that the state army/the huthi will opt to intentionelly target civilians belonging to a specific group (sunni/shia) with an intensity that woudl resolve this question.  Al-Quaida or at least ISIS might want to, but lacks the capability - although especially Al-Quaida amassed a lot of money by controlling ports in Yemen.
Based on general news and GJP consensus.
A difficult question as most violence will come from Saudis and other members of the coalition. However in the event of a "victory" pacification attempts by the government could lead to massacres.
Yemen has been festering longer than most ME countries, yet it didn't explode when everyone else did. They're just getting started.
Yemen is on the  path to becoming 2 states and it will involve civilian deaths along the way.   It is a proxy war with tribal not national interests involved in the power struggle.
Already in a war with entrenched state supporters
